messages.title: 3 great reasons to vote for Steven Haynes
messages.content: £2.5 billion invested in schools through the pupil premium. Two million new Apprenticeships since 2010. Taxes cut for 27 million people by £825.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Finish the job of balancing the books, as fairly as possible. The richest should pay more.
Protect education spending from cradle to college. Oppose Gove's two tier exams or schools.
Raise NHS spending by £8bn & guarantee mental health equality.
Cut Income Tax by a further £400 for ordinary workers.
Want five new Green laws - so Britain can become carbon neutral but prosperous and truly sustainable.

issues.economy: Finish the job of balancing the books, as fairly as possible.
issues.education: Protect education spending from cradle to college.
issues.environment: Want five new Green laws - so Britain can become carbon neutral but prosperous and truly sustainable.
issues.health: Raise NHS spending by £8bn & guarantee mental health equality.

leaflet.personalStatement: "We've seen that Labour can't be trusted to run the economy. The Tories have demonstrated they can't be trusted to look after the most vulnerable in society. Only the Liberal Democrats can build the strong economy the country needs whilst ensuring that fairness remains at the heart of what the Government does. By voting for me on May 7th you'll be voting for an MP who will fight to ensure Birmingham gets the support it needs to grow the local economy, and the resources needed to ensure that future generations can have a fair chance in life regardless of their background."

endorsements.endorsement: I have witnessed first-hand the devastating human cost of mental health, thanks to the failure to deal with the Lib Dems, this is finally being taken seriously.
Two million apprenticeships are helping young people and employers who need skilled workers. Vince Cable has made this happen - now we need more.

quotes.text: I notice the difference since the income tax cut. My pay slip each month is higher. Free school meals are also good - for the kids and the family budget.
